abstracts.cdata!:
This is a partial transcript of the
            Board discussion concerning the First Education Project in
            the Ivory Coast.  The project has two noteworthy features.
            The first time the Bank will be directly involved in the
            field of primary education and also, for the first time, the
            Bank will participate in the financing of instructional
            television. The Ivory Coast provides particularly justified
            grounds for these innovations. The reason is that the
            country has achieved remarkable economic performance since
            independence in 1960. Primary education has continued to
            prepare primary school leavers exclusively for secondary
            school entrance and for white collar jobs. In so doing it
            has failed to respond to the real needs of the economy. The
            Government is aware of these shortcomings and has drawn up a
            long-term educational program based on a new policy. The
            main objectives of this policy are to improve the efficiency
            of the system and to expand the output of technical,
            vocational, agricultural education; and at the secondary and
            post-secondary levels.
